instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1502 820-3476-A no boot
threads.message:
HI,

I have an A1502 820-3476-A that powers on, but it takes for ever loading OSX and always crashes when the loading bar (on the Apple black screen) reaches about 50%, making reboot and starting all over again.

It had a bit of corrosion on the U1900 and i've cleaned the solder and solder it back again.

Already replaced disk, but with the same result. All measures that i made were right, and don't know what else i can do. Can you help?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476-A no boot
threads.message:
Clean ME region into BIOS.
Some clean file should be already posted on the forum...

threads.title: A1502 820-3476-A no boot
threads.message: Thanks. Found one for the 820-3476. Is it the same?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476-A no boot
threads.message:
Only if specifies to be clean ME.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1H6gUd8d2Dy8XndxY6_Db9cmIPg1wymUP/view?usp=sharing[/URL]
Already posted on the forum...

threads.title: A1502 820-3476-A no boot
threads.message:
Thnaks! yesterday already downloaded one from the forum with the Clean ME (didn't know that).
After instaled new file, the behavier is the same. Even instaling new OSX, it doesn't pass half bar...

threads.title: A1502 820-3476-A no boot
threads.message:
Sorry...
I couldn't find it on the forum, or on the web. Can you please tell me where I can download it?

threads.title: A1502 820-3476-A no boot
threads.message: It passed all tests. No error found...

threads.title: A1502 820-3476-A no boot
threads.message:
Can you install Windows on it?
If yes, then start to install drivers and see when it crashes.
